libraryItems.meaningful_description: This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 8, "Numbers 1–10." During this lesson, children will draw 7 objects and write the numeral 7. They will also order numbers 1 through 10.

This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 9, "Practice with 5-Groups." During this lesson, children will identify from the number word and order numbers 1–10. They will also count out and make groups of 5 through 10 with 5-groups.

This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 10, "Numbers 6, 7, and 8." During this lesson, children will act out addition, subtraction, and partners math stories. They will also draw 8 objects and write the numeral 8.

This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 11, "Addition and Subtraction Stories: Garden Scenario." During this lesson, children will create and solve addition and subtraction stories. They will also write the numeral 9 and draw 9 objects.
libraryItems.display_title: Lesson 2.11 Addition and Subtraction Stories: Garden Scenario (Homework)

libraryItems.meaningful_description: This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 12, "Numbers 1 Through 10: The +1 Pattern." During this lesson, children will build concepts of numbers 1 through 10 and explore the +1 relationship between numbers.
This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 13, "Identify Triangles." During this lesson, children will identify and classify triangles by their attributes.

This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 14, "More Numbers 1 Through 10: The +1 Pattern." During this lesson, children will build concepts of numbers 1–10 and will explore the + 1 relationship between numbers.
libraryItems.display_title: Lesson 2.14 More Numbers 1 Through 10: The +1 Pattern (Homework)

libraryItems.meaningful_description: This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 15, "Addition and Subtraction Stories: Family Experiences." During this lesson, children will act out addition, subtraction, and partner situations. They will also write the number 10 and draw 10 objects.
libraryItems.display_title: Lesson 2.15 Addition and Subtraction Stories: Family Experiences (Homework)

libraryItems.meaningful_description: This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 16, "Numbers 1 Through 10: The –1 Pattern." During this lesson, children will build concepts of numbers 1–10 and explore the –1 relationship between numbers.
This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 17, "Identify Hexagons." During this lesson, children will identify and classify hexagons by their attributes.
This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 18, "Number Writing Practice." During this lesson, children will write numbers 1 through 10 and compare two numbers.

This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 19, "More Numbers 1 Through 10: The -1 Pattern." During this lesson, children will build concepts of numbers 1–10 and explore the -1 relationship between numbers. They will also order numbers through 10.
libraryItems.display_title: Lesson 2.19 More Numbers 1 Through 10: The -1 Pattern (Homework)

libraryItems.meaningful_description: This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 20, "Focus on Mathematical Practices." During this lesson, children will apply mathematical concepts in meaningful contexts.

This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 1, "Numbers 1–10 and Math Stories: Park Scene." During this lesson, children will learn how to find groups of 1 through 10 and identify partners.
libraryItems.display_title: Lesson 3.1 Numbers 1–10 and Math Stories: Park Scene (Homework)

libraryItems.meaningful_description: This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 2, "Groups of 10." During this lesson, children will identify 10-groups within teen numbers.
This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 3, "Explore Partners Through 6." During this lesson, children will learn to find partners of numbers 2 through 6.

This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 4, "Addition and Subtraction Stories: Park Scene." During this lesson, children will learn to tell and solve addition and subtraction story problems.
libraryItems.display_title: Lesson 3.4 Addition and Subtraction Stories: Park Scene (Homework)

libraryItems.meaningful_description: This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 5, "More Groups of 10." During this lesson, children will learn to show tens in teen numbers and draw numbers 6 through 10 using 5-groups.

This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 6, "Model Partners Through 6 with Counters." During this lesson, children will find partners of numbers 2 through 6. They also learn to show teen numbers as a group of ten ones and extra ones.
libraryItems.display_title: Lesson 3.6 Model Partners Through 6 with Counters (Homework)

libraryItems.meaningful_description: This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 7, "More Addition and Subtraction Stories: Park Scene." During this lesson, children will tell and solve addition and subtraction stories and show numbers 6 through 10 using 5-groups.
libraryItems.display_title: Lesson 3.7 More Addition and Subtraction Stories: Park Scene (Homework)

libraryItems.meaningful_description: This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 8, "Show Tens and Ones." During this lesson, children will make teen numbers using 5-groups.
This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 9, "Make New Shapes." During this lesson, children will learn to compose 2-dimensional shapes.

This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 10, "Explore Classifying." During this lesson, children will learn how to classify using various attributes, and compare and order the categories by number.

This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 11, "Practice Addition and Subtraction Stories: Park Scene." During this lesson, children will tell and solve addition and subtraction stories. They will also show numbers 6 through 10 using 5-groups.
libraryItems.display_title: Lesson 3.11 Practice Addition and Subtraction Stories: Park Scene (Homework)

libraryItems.meaningful_description: This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 12, "Practice Classifying." During this lesson, children will classify using various attributes, and compare and order the categories by number. They will also use = and ≠ signs.
This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 13, "Build Teen Numbers." During this lesson, children will practice using 5-groups and making teen numbers.
This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 14, "Practice with 5-Groups." During this lesson, children will review using 5 groups and use = and ≠ signs.

This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 15, "Tens in Teens." During this lesson, children will show teen numbers in a group of ten ones and further ones. They will also match partners and totals for teen numbers.

This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 16, "Stories and Partners." During this lesson, children will tell and solve addition and subtraction stories. They will also show partners for numbers 2 through 7.

This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 17, "Practice with Partners." During this lesson, children will show all partners for numbers 2 through 7. They will also match partner expressions with teen numbers.

This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 18, "Build Teen Numbers with Classroom Objects." During this lesson, children will show a group of ten when building a teen number. They will also see and record partners for 5, 6, and 7.
libraryItems.display_title: Lesson 3.18 Build Teen Numbers with Classroom Objects (Homework)

libraryItems.meaningful_description: This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 19, "Show Teen Numbers with Classroom Objects." During this lesson, children will show a group of ten when making a teen number and match partners and totals for teen numbers.
libraryItems.display_title: Lesson 3.19 Show Teen Numbers with Classroom Objects (Homework)

libraryItems.meaningful_description: This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 20, "Object Collections: Teen Numbers." During this lesson, children will make teen numbers with ten ones and further ones. They will also match partners and totals for teen numbers.

This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 21, "Focus on Mathematical Practices." During this lesson, children will learn to apply mathematical concepts and skills in meaningful contexts. They also use the Common Core Standards and Practices in a variety of real-world problem solving situations.

This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 1, "Number Stories 1–10 and Math Stories: Grocery Store Scenario." During this lesson, children will experience adding and subtracting situations in the real world and define ways to sort objects.
libraryItems.display_title: Lesson 4.1 Number Stories 1–10 and Math Stories: Grocery Store Scenario (Homework)

libraryItems.meaningful_description: This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 2, "Find Partners of 10." During this lesson, children will identify partners of 6, 7, and 10.

This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 3, "Teen Numbers and Equations." During this lesson, children will show teen numbers as a group of ten ones and some extra ones and as 10 + a 1-digit number.

This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 4, "Addition and Subtraction Stories: Grocery Store Scenario." During this lesson, children will explore and express addition and subtraction story problems in buying and selling experiences.
libraryItems.display_title: Lesson 4.4 Addition and Subtraction Stories: Grocery Store Scenario (Homework)

libraryItems.meaningful_description: This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 5, "Practice with Teen Numbers and Partners." During this lesson, children will show teen numbers as a group of ten ones and extra ones and as 10 + a 1-digit number. Children will decompose numbers up to 7 into pairs in more than one way and record the pairs.
libraryItems.display_title: Lesson 4.5 Practice with Teen Numbers and Partners (Homework)

libraryItems.meaningful_description: This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 6, "Count, Match, and Compare." During this lesson, children will use drawings and write expressions to solve addition and subtraction story problems. Children will use matching and counting as strategies for comparing the number of objects in groups.

This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 7, "Practice Teen Numbers and Equations." During this lesson, children will show teen numbers as a group of ten ones and extra ones and as 10 + a 1-digit number. Children will decompose numbers up to 7 into pairs in more than one way and record the pairs.
libraryItems.display_title: Lesson 4.7 Practice Teen Numbers and Equations (Homework)

libraryItems.meaningful_description: This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 8, "Break-Apart Numbers for 10." During this lesson, children will find sets of partners for 10 and record sets of partners for 5–7 and 10.
This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 9, "Attributes of 3-Dimensional Shapes." During this lesson, children will describe and classify three-dimensional shapes.

This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 10, "Addition and Subtraction Drawings: Grocery Store Scenario." During this lesson, children will tell, draw, and solve addition and subtraction story problems. Children will compare numbers of objects in a group using matching and counting strategies.
libraryItems.display_title: Lesson 4.10 Addition and Subtraction Drawings: Grocery Store Scenario (Homework)

libraryItems.meaningful_description: This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 11, "Partners of 10 with 5-Groups." During this lesson, children will find partners of 10 in 5-groups and record sets of partners for 10, 6, 5, 4, 3, and 2.

This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 12, "Addition Equations." During this lesson, children will show teen numbers as a group of ten ones and extra ones and as 10 and a 1-digit number. Children will add within 6 through 10 and practice addition and subtraction fluency within 5.

This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 13, "More Partners of 10 with 5-Groups." During this lesson, children will find partners of 10 and review partners of 7, 8, and 9.
This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 14, "Identify Cubes." During this lesson, children will describe a cube and identify relative positions of shapes.

This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 15, "Addition and Subtraction Equations." During this lesson, children will create and solve addition and subtraction story problems and equations for numbers within 6–10 and for fluency within 5. Children will order numbers 1 through 20.

This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 16, "Teen Number Book." During this lesson, children will model teen numbers as a group of ten ones and extra ones and order numbers 1–19.

This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 17, "Addition Equations." During this lesson, children will solve addition equations within 5 and explore addition strategies.

This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 18, "Partners and Equations." During this lesson, children will write equations for partners and show teen numbers as a group of 10 ones and extra ones.

This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 19, "Write Addition Equations." During this lesson, children will find and write equations for partners and solve subtraction equations within 6 to 10.

This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 20, "Teen Number Book." During this lesson, children will model teen numbers as a group of ten ones and extra ones. Children match pictures to numbers, compare groups, and practice addition within 10.

This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 21, "Identify Cones and Cylinders." During this lesson, children will describe cones and cylinders and compose three-dimensional shapes.

This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 22, "Focus on Mathematical Practices." During this lesson, children will use the Common Core Standards and Practices in a variety of real-world problem-solving situations.

This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 1, "Math Stories and Scenes with Teen Numbers." During this lesson, children will create addition and subtraction story problems. They visualize and represent teen numbers as ten ones and extra ones.
libraryItems.display_title: Lesson 5.1 Math Stories and Scenes with Teen Numbers (Homework)

libraryItems.meaningful_description: This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 2, "Partners of 10: Stars in the Night Sky." During this lesson, children will create and count stars to make partners of 10 for a classroom display and count the number of objects in a group through 20.
libraryItems.display_title: Lesson 5.2 Partners of 10: Stars in the Night Sky (Homework)

libraryItems.meaningful_description: This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 3, "More Partners of 10: Stars in the Night Sky." During this lesson, children will write equations to show partners of 10 and identify an unknown partner of 10. They count by tens to 100 and show teen numbers as a group of ten ones and extra ones.
libraryItems.display_title: Lesson 5.3 More Partners of 10: Stars in the Night Sky (Homework)

libraryItems.meaningful_description: This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 4, "Solve and Retell Story Problems." During this lesson, children will tell, retell, and solve addition and subtraction story problems with drawings and equations. They will visualize teen numbers as 10 (two 5 groups) and extra ones.
libraryItems.display_title: Lesson 5.4 Solve and Retell Story Problems (Homework)

libraryItems.meaningful_description: This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 5, "Numbers 1–100." During this lesson, children will learn to write numbers through 100, represent number 1–20 as a group of ten ones and some more ones, and practice partners for numbers 7–9.

This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 6, "More Solve and Retell Story Problems." During this lesson, children will tell, retell, and write equations for addition and subtraction stories. They visualize teen numbers as ten ones and extra ones.
libraryItems.display_title: Lesson 5.6 More Solve and Retell Story Problems (Homework)

libraryItems.meaningful_description: This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 7, "Numbers 1–20." During this lesson, children will show numbers 1–20; they show the teen numbers as a group of ten ones and further ones. They find the unknown partner when the total and one partner are known.

This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 8, "Review Partners." During this lesson, children will find all the partners of 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, and 10. They view teen numbers as ten ones and extra ones, and practice finding 10-partners.

This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 9, "Partners of 6, 7, 8, and 9." During this lesson, children will visualize teen numbers in sequence as ten ones and extra ones and find the unknown partner when the total and one partner are known. They identify partners of the numbers 6 through 9.

This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 10, "Tens in Teen Numbers: A Game." During this lesson, children will solve addition and subtraction story problems and visualize teen numbers as ten ones and extra ones. They will use the = and ≠ signs in comparing.
libraryItems.display_title: Lesson 5.10 Tens in Teen Numbers: A Game (Homework)

libraryItems.meaningful_description: This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 11, "Tens in Teen Numbers Book." During this lesson, children will visualize teen numbers as ten ones and extra ones and find 10-partners.
libraryItems.display_title: Lesson 5.11 Tens in Teen Numbers Book (Homework)

libraryItems.meaningful_description: This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 12, "Partners of 10: Class Project." During this lesson, children will relate 10-partner drawings to addition equations and find changes in the partners of ten.

This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 13, "Introduction to Counting and Grouping Routines." During this lesson, children will count by ones and tens to 100. They find partners of 10 and write and discuss 7-partners.
libraryItems.display_title: Lesson 5.13 Introduction to Counting and Grouping Routines (Homework)

libraryItems.meaningful_description: This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 14, "Practice: Number Activities." During this lesson, children will equalize groups by adding and find partners of 7, 8, and 9.

This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 15, "Add Partners to Find Totals." During this lesson, children will show numbers 1–20, show the teen numbers as a group of ten ones and further ones. They find the unknown partner when the total and one partner are known and find the total of the two partners.
libraryItems.display_title: Lesson 5.15 Add Partners to Find Totals (Homework)

libraryItems.meaningful_description: This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 16, "Story Problems and Comparing: Totals Through 10." During this lesson, children will tell, retell, and solve addition and subtraction stories. They also compare the number of objects in two groups and take away objects to make groups equal.
libraryItems.display_title: Lesson 5.16 Story Problems and Comparing: Totals Through 10 (Homework)

libraryItems.meaningful_description: This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 17, "Subtract to Make Equal Groups." During this lesson, children will visualize teen numbers as ten ones and further ones. They compare the number of objects in groups and compare numbers.
libraryItems.display_title: Lesson 5.17 Subtract to Make Equal Groups (Homework)

libraryItems.meaningful_description: This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 18, "Tens and Ones." During this lesson, children will visualize teen numbers as a group of ten ones and further ones.

This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 19, "Teen Numbers, Partners, and Equations." During this lesson, children will tell, retell, and solve addition and subtraction stories. They show teen numbers as a group of ten ones and further ones.
libraryItems.display_title: Lesson 5.19 Teen Numbers, Partners, and Equations (Homework)

libraryItems.meaningful_description: This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 20, "More Tens in Teen Numbers: A Game." During this lesson, children will compare the number of objects in groups and compare numbers. They visualize teen numbers as ten ones and further ones.
libraryItems.display_title: Lesson 5.20 More Tens in Teen Numbers: A Game (Homework)

libraryItems.meaningful_description: This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 21, "Compare Length and Compare Height." During this lesson, children will compare two objects and identify which is longer or shorter. They compare two objects to identify which is taller or shorter.
libraryItems.display_title: Lesson 5.21 Compare Length and Compare Height (Homework)

libraryItems.meaningful_description: This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 22, "Compare Weight and Compare Capacity." During this lesson, children will compare two objects and identify which is heavier and lighter. They compare two containers and identify which has more or less capacity.
libraryItems.display_title: Lesson 5.22 Compare Weight and Compare Capacity (Homework)

libraryItems.meaningful_description: This resource provides practice with the key concepts and skills from Lesson 23, "Focus on Mathematical Practices." During this lesson, children will apply mathematical concepts and skills in a meaningful real-world context.
